briefTitle: The Effects of Sacubitril/Valsartan Compared to Valsartan on LV Remodelling in Asymptomatic LV Systolic Dysfunction After MI

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) at least 3 months prior to recruitment

  * Left ventricular ejection ≤40% as measured by transthoracic echocardiography
  * Ability to provide written, informed consent
  * Age ≥18 years
  * Tolerance of a minimum dose of ACE inhibitor/ARB (ramipril 2.5mg BD or equivalent)
  * Treatment with a beta-blocker unless not tolerated or contraindicated.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Contraindication to CMR (ferrous prosthesis, implantable cardiac device or severe claustrophobia)

  * Clinical and/or radiological heart failure (NYHA≥2)
  * Symptomatic hypotension and/or systolic blood pressure \<100mmHg
  * eGFR \< 30 mL/min/1.73m2 and/or serum potassium \>5.2mmol/L
  * Persistent/permanent atrial fibrillation
  * History of AMI within last 3 months
  * History of hypersensitivity or allergy to ACE-inhibitors/ARB
  * History of angioedema
  * Known hypersensitivity to the active study drug substances, contrast media or any of the excipients
  * Obesity (where body girth exceeds MRI scanner diameter)
  * Pregnancy, planning pregnancy, or breast feeding
  * Inability to give informed consent or comply with study protocol
  * Evidence of hepatic disease as determined by any one of the following: AST or ALT values exceeding 2 x ULN at Visit 1, history of hepatic encephalopathy, history of oesophageal varices, or history of portacaval shunt
  * History of biliary cirrhosis and cholestasis
  * Active treatment with cholestyramine or colestipol resins
  * Active treatment with lithium or direct renin inhibitor
  * Participation in another intervention study involving a drug or device within the past 90 days (co-enrolment in observational studies is permitted)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in indexed left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESVI) measured by cardiac MR measured in ml/m2

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in N-terminal Prohormone of B-type Natriuretic Peptide Levels
Change in High Sensitivity Troponin I Levels
Change in Left Ventricular End-Diastolic Volume Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in indexed left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDVI) measured by cardiac MR measured in ml/m2

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Left Atrial Volume Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in indexed Left Atrial Volume (LAVI) measured by cardiac MR measured in ml/m2

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) measured by cardiac MR measured in percentage

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Left Ventricular Mass Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in indexed left ventricular mass (LVMI) measured by cardiac MR measured in grams/m2

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Patient Well Being as Assessed by Patient Global Assessment Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in patient well being as assessed by patient global assessment questionnaire which is a patient reported outcome measure that involves a patients own response to questions about their overall health and/or disease activity

commonTop: Worsening renal function or acute kidney injury
Symptomatic hypotension with systolic blood pressure <90mmHg
